definition: to bow the head/to yield/to give in
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
smartphone addicts
to bow one's head in acknowledgment of guilt/to admit one's guilt

sentences.english: The maid lowered her chin and simpered.
Head up and prevent accidents do pancake.
sentences.chinese: 低头做烧饼，抬头防意外。

sentences.english: They were also reluctant to respond to international political pressure led by the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 他们还不愿向由美国主导的国际政治压力低头。

sentences.english: She lookeddown at her Viennese fan of eagle feathers, and he sawthat her lips trembled.
sentences.chinese: 她低头看着那把羽毛扇，他发现她的双唇在颤抖。

sentences.english: He stared down at his dinner plate in a morose and unsociable manner.
sentences.chinese: 他低头盯着餐盘，一副冷淡不友好的样子。

sentences.english: She knelt down and bowed her head in prayer.
I looked down into my five-year-old son's sympathetic face.
sentences.chinese: 我低头看着五岁的儿子，那是一张充满同情的小脸。

sentences.english: Pike ceremony known as the bow ceremony, in fact it is a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 屈体礼被称为低头礼，实际上这是一种误解。

sentences.english: Frequently looking down can indicate submissiveness or embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 低头往下看通常都表示顺从或不好意思。

sentences.english: A person firmly committed to faith in God does not bow to tempting or compromising situations.
sentences.chinese: 坚定忠信于神的人不向诱人或妥协的景况低头。

sentences.english: It remains to be seen whether the grass will bend as this wind blows.
sentences.chinese: 至于这股风吹起的时候草是否会低头，还有待观察。

sentences.english: Catherine stared down into the patient's abdominal cavity.
sentences.chinese: 柯瑟琳低头看着病人的腹腔。

sentences.english: Put your head down in front of this garage. Under that dumpster is a big pile of money.
sentences.chinese: 你低头看车库前面，在那个垃圾桶下面有一大撂钞票。

sentences.english: As she looked ahead down the long ramp leading to the guard's gate, her heart sank.
sentences.chinese: 低头看着前面通往安检门的坡道，她的心沉了下去。

sentences.english: Roll head gently from side to side, then forward and backward.
sentences.chinese: 柔和地向两边拉伸脖子，然后同样向前低头向后仰脖。

sentences.english: He looked down at his roses, and went on watering them.
sentences.chinese: 他低头看着他的玫瑰花，继续给它们浇水。

definition: to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to stoop
to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to stand up
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to lift up
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
to immerse oneself in/engrossed in sth/to lower the head (e.g. to avoid rain)/countersunk (of screws, rivets etc)
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to look askance/cross or wall-eyed
slight/faint/humble
in silence/not speaking
to raise one's head
